td.content: s:31 year old male presents with severe headache. he also reports moderate nausea, mild vomiting, Traumatic Injury - Blunt associated with the severe headache. a short time ago he sustained a blow to the front of the head (26 min LOC) o:Height 68 in, Weight 142 lbs, Temperature 97.9 F, Pulse 83, SystolicBP 108, DiastolicBP 66, Respiration 15, CT Head (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB, MRI Brain Unremarkable, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex, appears in NAD, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Chest = normal breathing sounds B/L, Neuro: WNL a:TBI (concussion) p:administered Acetaminophen - 650 mg po/pr q 6 hrs PRN pain, performed CT Head, MRI Brain, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed, and ordered rest, and referred patient to family practice/primary care.

td.content: s:male columnist aged 31 years presents for recheck following traumatic incident. he was seen in local EMD for injuries, including a concussion (26 min LOC). he reports doing fine with no problems and denies nausea, headache and vomiting he consumes 2 drinks per night denies any smoking o:Height 69 in, Weight 146 lbs, Temperature 98.1 F, Pulse 84, SystolicBP 113, DiastolicBP 73, Respiration 17, ImPACT test Verbal Memory=98,Visual Memory=97,Processing Speed=46.1,Reaction Time=0.47, Abd: Scaphoid, soft, ND, NTTP. BS WNL, MS: Extremities x 4 WNL. Strength 5/5, equal bilaterally, Neuro: CN II-XII WNL. No deficits, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex, HEENT: NCAT, PERRL, Neck: Supple, C/V: RRR, Pulm: CTAB. Good effort a:S/P Concussion (with loss of consciousness of 30 minutes or less). No sequelae p:performed ImPACT test, and performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed.
